alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; South Lincoln County; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Upper Green River Basin; Upper Green River Basin Foothills; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL IMPACT YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK...TETON LINCOLN AND WESTERN SUBLETTE COUNTIES... A snow squall accompanied by winds in excess of 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. At 243 PM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Kepler Cascades to near Buffalo Valley Ranch to 14 miles north of Bondurant to Lander Peak to near Sage Junction and moving east at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Jackson, Kemmerer, Pinedale, Dubois, Big Piney, Cokeville, Lake, Moran Junction, Old Faithful, Grant Village, South Entrance, East Entrance, Marbleton, Diamondville, La Barge, Daniel, Cora, Opal, Bondurant, Fossil Butte National Monument and Sage Junction. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
